doc.field: RG 33.5. John Brademas Center for the Study of Congress
RG 33.5. John Brademas Center for the Study of Congress
New York University Archives Collection of Publications and Ephemera
New York University Archives Collection of Publications and Ephemera

Reports and publications from the John Brademas Center that works to develop a greater understanding of the United States Congress. Publications focus not only on examining the rules and procedures of Congress but also the ways in which the Senate and House of Representatives help determine the substance of law and policy for the Government of the United States â€“ through their leaders, committees, caucuses, conferences, staffs and individual members, and through the interaction of Congress with the executive and judicial branches. Publications also focus on public opinion about Congress.
John Brademas Center Publications Archived Website: May 2022-ongoing
